txt.en:
'Greetings to you, stranger! Are you here to try out our obstacle course? Only the most experienced of riders will be able to master such a tricky path in the amount of time we have allotted.'

'The rules are very simple -- race through each gate, and you mustn't fall off your steed before the time runs out. When you see two gates next to one another, you must choose which path to take, be it high or low. The low path may be muddy, and the high is sure to be dry, but precarious indeed. There will be other hurdles to disrupt you as well.'

'Do you feel up for this challenge? Only the most spirited riders should even attempt such a feat! It is sure to be very dangerous, but you have a hardy look to you.'
'It is rare to see such excellent riding in these parts, [placeholder]! I am very impressed.'
You have begun the race

You have lost the race
Your steed is slowed by a sticky mire....

The Farmers Faire Run is a time-honoured tradition in the Horsefields of Bree. Many challenges have been laid down to present a tricky course for the brave riders of Middle-earth who wish to demonstrate their mettle on horseback.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000> NOTE: This quest will be removed from your quest log when the event it is associated with ends. </rgb>
You gain a burst of speed for your agile navigation
You have lost the race
Race through the low sixth gate through sticky mud
Race through the high sixth gate over the precarious jump
Race to the seventh gate
Race to the eighth gate
Cross the finish line before the time runs out
Speak with Sally Threshing
Mount a race-horse
Mount a race-pony
Cross the starting line to enter the race-track
Race to the first gate
Race to the second gate
Race through the low third gate through sticky mud
Race through the high third gate over the precarious jump
Race to the fourth gate
Race to the fifth gate

The festival steeds can be found spoiling for the race in the stable at the Bree-fields Festival Grounds.\n\nYou should mount a steed to begin the race -- a pony if you are shorter in stature, or a horse if you are of a taller build.

The finish line is near!\n\nYou must cross the finish line before the time runs out.
Sally Threshing stands next to the finish line at the race-track in Bree.\n\nYou should speak with Sally Threshing and inform her of your success.
